title: Why do Mercurial Scimitar, Maw, and Edge of knight all exist?
body:
I seriously don't get why ad champions can become basically immune (Not literally but you know what i mean) to magic damage while ap champions have to build zhonyahs and still get shredded by lethality.


*lol its supposed to be edge of night.

replies.body: because everyone gets armor per level, and most people don't get mr per level.

This is a big part of it.

As for the OP, build GA if you need another armor item. GA + HG is one of the most cancer things mages can do, and they should abuse it until those items (or at least their effects) are removed.

They probably won't because it doesn't give them AP. 

Mages avoid non AP items like the plague.
Then complain when they get squished because they have no defense. XD
Causes most mages do jack all damage without alot of ap
Who says you can't have a lot of AP?

Lets see, we need HG and GA. Along with boots thats about 70 ap(85 with runes). A morello, (185) a void staff (255) and then Rabadons (375) (473) Ap. But thats if you went full damage. Realistically, the Rabadons or even Void is replaced with a Rylais or Hextech item for health, and sometimes even a SV or Deadmans. So average game length of 20-30 minutes would equal about 3-4 items so around 280 ish ap

Wait, who the fk builds Deadman's on an AP mid? Or SV? No, that is just wrong.

(AP goes up to 550 if you use scaling AP blues, btw)

You honestly are going to tell me he does "jack all damage" with this set up? I don't think so. You'd be wrong if you did.
none of the champs you listed are really mages. they are more like ap assassin/bruisers.
It's a vicious cycle.

Assassins avoid non ad items like the plague?

I think the problem here is that in an ad vs ap matchup the ad champion always has the upper hand because they have  such a variety of build options. Mages are forced into zhonyas because it is their only option.

Why do tanks have less than half as many realistic options for MR than they do for armor?

There are 2 different sources of AD damage- AD abilities and auto attacks. There is only 1 source of AP- AP abilities. Tanks, in order to resist both auto attacks and AD abilities, need more options for armor. Not so for AP.

Being ranged doesn't remove the skill factor involved in landing skillshots, a factor that doesn't come into play for assassins

Aim is a non factor in team fights as everyone is clumped together and mages can just roll their faces.  Factor in the fact that their skillshots are usually aoe and spammable and it gets pretty easy to team fight as a mage.  Meanwhile assassins need to play proactively, constantly looking for openings, waiting out cooldowns, one miss step and you die in a team fight.  
They don't get the liberty of sitting from range, they have to get into the fight while being an extremely squishy champion.  Btw  Zed's triple q is arguably harder than almost all mage skillshots in the game, so chill with the "but we have to aim" bullshit.
